title: Production mode build fails with experiments.outputModule: true together with optimization.runtimeChunk: 'single'
body:
<!-- Please don't delete this template because we'll close your issue -->
<!-- Before creating an issue please make sure you are using the latest version of webpack. -->

# Bug report

<!-- Please ask questions on StackOverflow or the webpack Gitter. -->
<!-- https://stackoverflow.com/questions/ask?tags=webpack -->
<!-- https://gitter.im/webpack/webpack -->
<!-- Issues which contain questions or support requests will be closed. -->

**What is the current behavior?**
Running webpack-cli prints the following error:
```
ERROR in runtime.js from Terser
'return' outside of function [runtime.js:130,9]
```

**If the current behavior is a bug, please provide the steps to reproduce.**
Reproduction repository: https://github.com/ludofischer/webpack-outputmodule-bug
1. Create this `webpack.config.js`:

```javascript
module.exports = {
    experiments: {outputModule: true},
    mode: 'production',
    optimization: {
      runtimeChunk: 'single'
    }
}
```
2. Install webpack and webpack-cli
3. Place your source in `src/index.js` 
4. run `npx webpack`
<!-- A great way to do this is to provide your configuration via a GitHub repository -->
<!-- The most helpful is a minimal reproduction with instructions on how to reproduce -->
<!-- Repositories with too many files or large `webpack.config.js` files are not suitable -->
<!-- Please only add small code snippets directly into this issue -->
<!-- https://gist.github.com is a good place for longer code snippets -->
<!-- If your issue is caused by a plugin or loader, please create an issue on the loader/plugin repository instead -->

**What is the expected behavior?**
I think either:
1. output just the minified application code in `dist/`
2. output the minified application code and a minified webpack runtime
3. give an error message saying  `runtimeChunk: 'single'` is useless with `outputModule: true` 

I am not sure about the expected behaviour because I don't know whether the webpack runtime is ever needed with `outputModule: true`. 
<!-- "It should work" is not a helpful explanation -->
<!-- Explain exactly how it should behave -->

**Other relevant information:**
The code builds if we change `mode: production` to `mode: 'development'` in `webpack.config.js`. 
I see that without `runtimeChunk: 'single'`, the runtime is not included in the bundle .

webpack version:  5.11
Node.js version: v14.15.1
Operating System: Fedora 33
Additional tools: none
